intro: Noronhia mannii, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its berries, which are typically yellow or orange when ripe, are edible but can be toxic if consumed in large quantities. Noronhia mannii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
